## Interfaces

<table><thead><tr><th>

Interface


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[Cancellable](./influxdb3-client.cancellable.md)


</td><td>

Allows to cancel a running execution.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[ChunkCombiner](./influxdb3-client.chunkcombiner.md)


</td><td>

ChunkCombiner is a simplified platform-neutral manipulation of Uint8arrays that allows to process text data on the fly. The implementation can be optimized for the target platform (node vs browser).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[ClientOptions](./influxdb3-client.clientoptions.md)


</td><td>

Options used by [InfluxDBClient](./influxdb3-client.influxdbclient.md) .


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[CommunicationObserver](./influxdb3-client.communicationobserver.md)


</td><td>

Observes communication with the server.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[ConnectionOptions](./influxdb3-client.connectionoptions.md)


</td><td>

Option for the communication with InfluxDB server.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[Logger](./influxdb3-client.logger.md)


</td><td>

Logging interface.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[QueryOptions](./influxdb3-client.queryoptions.md)


</td><td>

Options used by [InfluxDBClient.query()](./influxdb3-client.influxdbclient.query.md) and by [InfluxDBClient.queryPoints()](./influxdb3-client.influxdbclient.querypoints.md)<!-- -->.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

</td><td>

</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[Transport](./influxdb3-client.transport.md)


</td><td>

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[WriteOptions](./influxdb3-client.writeoptions.md)


</td><td>

## Variables

<table><thead><tr><th>

Variable


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[consoleLogger](./influxdb3-client.consolelogger.md)


</td><td>

Logger that logs to console.out


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[currentTime](./influxdb3-client.currenttime.md)


</td><td>

Exposes functions that creates strings that represent a timestamp that can be used in the line protocol. Micro and nano timestamps are emulated depending on the js platform in use.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[dateToProtocolTimestamp](./influxdb3-client.datetoprotocoltimestamp.md)


</td><td>

dateToProtocolTimestamp provides converters for JavaScript Date to InfluxDB Write Protocol Timestamp. Keys are supported precisions.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[DEFAULT\_ConnectionOptions](./influxdb3-client.default_connectionoptions.md)


</td><td>

default connection options


</td></tr>

[QueryType](./influxdb3-client.querytype.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[ResponseStartedFn](./influxdb3-client.responsestartedfn.md)


</td><td>

Informs about a start of response processing.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[WritableData](./influxdb3-client.writabledata.md)


</td><td>

The `WritableData` type represents different types of data that can be written. The data can either be a uniform ArrayLike collection or a single value of the following types:

- `Point`<!-- -->: Represents a [Point](./influxdb3-client.point.md) object.

- `string`<!-- -->: Represents lines of the [Line Protocol](https://bit.ly/2QL99fu)<!-- -->.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[WritePrecision](./influxdb3-client.writeprecision.md)


</td><td>

Timestamp precision used in write operations. See [https://docs.influxdata.com/influxdb/latest/api/\#operation/PostWrite](https://docs.influxdata.com/influxdb/latest/api/#operation/PostWrite)


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
